meanings.definition: To celebrate with extravagant public demonstrations of joy or delight.
meanings.sent1: The whole town will maffick when the team wins the championship.
meanings.sent2: The crowd began to maffick after the announcement of the victory.
meanings.sent3: The children decided to maffick by throwing confetti everywhere.
meanings.sent4: The fans continued to maffick long into the night, singing and dancing.
meanings.sent5: The bride and groom mafficked with laughter and tears on their wedding day.

meanings.sent1: The parade was a maffick of colors, music, and dancing.
meanings.sent2: The festival turned into a joyful maffick that lasted until dawn.
meanings.sent3: The birthday party turned into a lively maffick with games and laughter.
meanings.sent4: The carnival was a maffick of sights and sounds, overwhelming the senses.
meanings.sent5: The New Year's Eve maffick filled the streets with laughter and cheers.
